class_notes:
This course will introduce and identify a variety of possibilities within the genre of New Media, specifically sound art, 3-D digital space-making, and video projection. The class time will primarily be focused on hands-on creating digital artwork through demos, collaborative projects, lectures on New Media history, and in-class lab time. Readings will be geared towards providing students with a foundation of knowledge of contemporary new media artists and practices, as well as the positionality of new media within a larger cultural context. In order to help students on their own idea generation, we will also study specific aesthetics and theoretical concerns of working in new media. Through a series of workshops, projects, and a final project, students will also gain technical skills in sound editing, 3D rendering, and video editing for an art context.
Prerequisite: ARTVIS 109 or permission from the instructor: jane.foley@emory.edu
